the Gabriel's barplot (or (l-u)-plot) — gabriel.plot
code: # equal numbers  g <- c(1:50) f <- c(rep(1,10),rep(2,10),rep(3,10),rep(4,10),rep(5,10)) gabriel.plot(g,f,rgabriel(g,f))   # unequal numbers  g <- c(1:40) f <- c(rep(1,3),rep(2,12),rep(3,15),rep(4,5),rep(5,5)) gabriel.plot(g,f,rgabriel(g,f))

what: Gabriel Multiple Comparison Test and Plot the Confidence Interval on Barplot — rgabriel-package
title: Gabriel Multiple Comparison Test and Plot the Confidence Interval on Barplot — rgabriel-package
text: Functions conducting plotting Gabriel's (1978) multiple comparison test accounting unequal variance unequal sample sizes.

title: Gabriel Multiple Comparison Test and Plot the Confidence Interval on Barplot — rgabriel-package
text: package created analyze multi-level one-way experimental designs. designed handle vectorized observation factor data unequal sample sizes population variance homogeneity can assumed.conduct Gabriel test, create two vectors: one observations one factor level observation. function, rgabriel, conduct test save output vector input gabriel.plot function, produces confidence interval plot Multiple Comparison.
